sentences.en: ...a blot on the reputation of the architectural profession.
Are you saying that she's trying to blot out all memory of the incident?
sentences.cn: 你是说她想彻底忘掉这件事？

sentences.en: At least now, of all times, he wanted to blot the fact out.
sentences.cn: 至少是现在, 他比其他时候更加愿意把那件事情一笔勾销.

sentences.en: Before applying make-up, blot the face with a tissue to remove any excess oils.
sentences.cn: 上妆前，先用面巾纸把脸上多余的油吸干。

sentences.en: Before applying makeup, blot the face with a tissue to remove any excess oils.
sentences.cn: 化妆之前，用纸巾吸干脸上所有过多的油。

sentences.en: Blot your letter before folding it.
sentences.cn: 折信前,你先把信上的墨迹吸干.

sentences.en: Celia tried to blot out the present.
sentences.cn: 西莉亚竭力排开眼前的事.

sentences.en: He tried to blot out the memory of that embarrassing moment.
sentences.cn: 他试图忘掉那令人窘迫的时刻。

sentences.en: His involvement in the scandal was a blot on his reputation.
sentences.cn: 他因卷入丑闻,在名誉上留下污点.

sentences.en: Is there any way to remove the ink blot on my dress?
sentences.cn: 有什么办法去掉我衣服上的墨渍 吗 ?

sentences.en: It has the irregular form of an ink blot.
sentences.cn: 它具有不规则的水渍形状.

sentences.en: It seems as if the blanket of depression is in some way necessary to help them blot out the even greater pain of real life.
sentences.cn: 似乎这种弥漫的抑郁情绪多少能帮助他们忘却一些现实生活中更大的痛苦。

sentences.en: That foolish deed of his will remain a blot on his escutcheon.
sentences.cn: 他的那种愚蠢行为将永远是他名誉上的污点.

sentences.en: That new factory is a blot on the landscape.
sentences.cn: 那新建的工厂破坏了此地的景色

sentences.en: The developers insist the 80m village will not leave a blot on the landscape.
sentences.cn: 开发商们坚称这个耗资8,000万的居住区不会破坏风景。

sentences.en: There is a blot of ink on the paper.
This drugs scandal is another blot on the Olympics.
sentences.cn: 这次的兴奋剂丑闻又给奥林匹克运动会抹了黑。

sentences.en: This reflection intervened to blot luxurious picturings of her.
sentences.cn: 这种想法的介入排挤掉了对她的美好想象.

words.tran_cn: 记事簿，[会计] 流水帐；吸墨纸

phrases.tran_cn: 影响景观的物体（尤指丑陋建筑物）
玷污自己的名声，给自己抹黑
完全清除（思想、记忆等）；遮盖
有意地忘记（不愉快的记忆或想法）；抹去

trans.tran_cn: 污渍，墨渍，弱点，（十五子棋中）易被吃掉的孤立棋子
trans.tran_en: a mark or dirty spot on something, especially made by ink

trans.tran_cn: 吸墨水；弄上墨渍或污渍
trans.tran_en: to make a wet surface become dry by pressing soft paper or cloth on it
